recordings.rmk: Light hiss reduction was used.

At the shore of the wadden sea. A group of ca. 150 birds waiting and retiring from time to time from the ascending flood. I saw only Grey Plowers there when I went there and when I came backl, but I cannot exclude that there were some other birds in the meantime when I leaved the recorder alone.
Sound was trapped at the shore of the wadden sea short after sunset.
In the wadden sea.

NFC - Nocturnal Flight Call
Remote Station (records made during the night to detect nocturnal migrant birds)

Astronomical Twilight: 5:33 - 6:06 (https://www.timeanddate.com/sun/@8010525)

Recorder: Zoom H1n
Windscreen: Zoom WSU-1
File format: WAV 48000Hz 24bits

Sound analysis software: I use Audacity to extract and edit (High-pass filter 500Hz/6dB, sound normalized to -3dB) .
